body: Hi @pdxjohnny in this issue do we need to check weather the source files like `CSV or SQL` are ending with a new line or right ?
@Pratikrocks "source" in this case means source code, so `.rst`, `.py`, `.js`, `.md`, `.toml`, `.cfg`, etc. Anything that's text.

rename.from: ci: run: newline: Write a check that makes sure that all source files end with a newline
rename.to: ci: run: newline: Write a check that makes sure that all text files end with a newline

body:
@pdxjohnny there are a large number of files currently which are not ending with a new line take for example this files last line [FILE](https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/d309db8503ab3c29fcd99b96479c24b2fdd4d200/dffml/df/base.py#L1028)

similarly, several files are there so should we add a new line to all such files and then write a `pytest`  for checking a newline in other files?

rename.from: ci: run: newline: Write a check that makes sure that all text files end with a newline
rename.to: tests: style: Write a check that makes sure that all text files end with a newline

body:
@Pratikrocks

> There are a large number of files currently which are not ending with a new line take for example this files last line [FILE](https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/d309db8503ab3c29fcd99b96479c24b2fdd4d200/dffml/df/base.py#L1028)

We want to check if the last byte in the file is `b"\n"`

> similarly, several files are there so should we add a new line to all such files and then write a `pytest` for checking a newline in other files?

Good plan! Let's add it under `tests/test_style.py`
Okay then am just adding an extra "\n" to pre-existing files ( excluding files  hidden dirs and binaries)  and then modifying the test/test_styles.py

You can use the `IngoreFile` class in `tests/test_ci.py` to make sure you aren't getting anything that's in a `.gitignore`, and then `pathlib.Path.rglob` to grab all the files.

- First open a PR with the test implemented.

- Then add the newline byte where required in a spertate commit after you see that the test you added caused the CI to fail, and then the CI run for the test where you add the byte to each file it's missing from will cause the CI to pass.

issue.title: unnit test for adding a new line at the end of source files

repository.name: dffml
repository.description: The easiest way to use Machine Learning. Mix and match underlying ML libraries and data set sources. Generate new datasets or modify existing ones with ease.

body: Hi @pdxjohnny, if no one is working on this issue, I would like to work on it. As I am new to open source it would be great if you can guide me too.
